title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open a file in another editor if already opened (should give error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open a file in another editor if already opened (should give error message)
OB: When a file is already opened in one editor, attempting to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With' -> 'System Editor' does not produce any result. There should be a warning message displayed in the workbench stating that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes and asking if the user wants to continue. Alternatively, there should be an error message indicating that all files must be closed first before opening the file in another editor. We believe this behavior is intended for safety, as WSAD does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in WSAD.
EB: When attempting to open a file in another editor that is already opened in one editor, a warning message should be displayed in the workbench. The warning message should state that opening the file in another editor may overwrite changes and ask if the user wants to continue. If the user tries to open the file without closing all files first, an error message should be displayed.
SR:
1. Open a file in one editor. 
2. Go to the Java Perspective. 
3. Double-click on a Java file to open it in the workbench. 
4. Right-click on the same Java file. 
5. Select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. 
6. Observe that nothing happens. 
7. Close the file. 
8. Repeat steps 3-5. 
9. Observe that a warning message should be displayed, asking if the user wants to continue opening the file in another editor. 
10. Close all files. 
11. Repeat steps 3-5. 
12. Observe that an error message should be displayed, indicating that all files must be closed before opening the file in another editor.
